Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish living in its water environment (like a lake, river, or ocean).
The student can label the parts of the fish's habitat, like water and plants.
The student can show and label what the fish needs to survive, such as water to swim in and food to eat.
The student can draw and label other living things in the same habitat, like plants and other animals.
The student can show and label how the fish and other living things are part of a system, using arrows or lines to connect them with what they need.
